wikipedia_page.main: Alison Dorothy Hughes  (née Lang; born 1971/1972) is a British tennis umpire who has umpired in multiple women's Grand Slam tennis finals, as well as in the Davis Cup, Fed Cup and at the 2004, 2008, 2016 and 2020 Summer Olympics. She is one of only two persons to have chair umpired a singles finals match in all four of the Grand Slam tournaments, the other being Carlos Ramos. She attended Ponteland High School in Newcastle upon Tyne.

response: * Alison Hughes (born 1971/72), née Lang, British tennis umpire

Carlos Ramos (born 1971) is a Portuguese tennis umpire. Ramos, a gold badge chair umpire certified by the International Tennis Federation, is one of only two persons to have chair umpired a singles finals match in all four of the Grand Slam tournaments, the other being Alison Hughes. Ramos is also notable for umpiring many other high-profile matches and for penalizing several high-profile players during his decades-long career.
